Player History
Drafted in 4th round, 93rd overall pick, by Northeastern in 1969...
Injured on 7/8/1970 with a Blister On Finger, out for 3 days...
Injured on 7/12/1973 with a Inflamed Thigh Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 8/19/1974 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 6 days...
Injured on 5/18/1975 with a Strained Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 5/22/1975 with a Bruised Foot, out for 4 days...
Had first career hit on 9/14/1975, off Elly Mae Clampett (NJ)...
Released by Northeastern on 11/3/1976...
Signed as a free agent by Bay City on 11/3/1976 to a 1-year deal worth $300,000 per year...
Hit first career homerun on 4/21/1977, off Richard Lin (WIS)...
Injured on 8/3/1977 with a Hyper Extended Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Second Base in 1977...
Injured on 8/18/1978 with a Broken Ankle, out for 8 weeks...
Won World Championship with Bay City in 1982...
Traded from Bay City to Malibu on 2/5/1983 (Going to BC: P R. Higa, 1B H. Yan, 2B J. Pinney. Going to Mal: 2B C. Few, C R. Ambriz)...
